the single easiest decision is to buy and hold
‎
Might go to 20k first, might not
‎
But you’ll end up in profit before the ETF is approved

don't mid curve this

Don’t gamble your precious BTC away

You can dump it on some boomer in the US in a few months or years time
‎
The exit liquidity is known! Don’t fuck it up

As for when the approval will come, that’s entirely in the hands of Blackrock imo

people say they’re pushing hard for approval, I think that’s just trying to make people fomo in early

my bet would be late this year

Blackrock have something like a 550-1 approval to rejection record for ETFs
What happens when investors try to front run Blackrock, Fidelity AND the halving all at the same time?
This ⬆️ ⬆️

and most of all, know what you're doing

Basically every alt is now in a H4 downtrend

if BTC even sneezes, alts drop 5%

further confirmation that we are still firmly in a bear market for alts

this is normal, not surprising

you want to separate BTC and alts in your mind

I have scanned market looking for swing shorts

not much worth targeting

Many alts pumped last week and have bullish daily trends (12 above 21)

LINK is an example

H4 looks bearish, with a MSB and bands close to crossing

possibly a shakeout here

reversal likely

but BTC keeps finding resistance before 31000 so we might just be 

stuck rangebound for a while

At this point, i will buy the next touch of 31k with invalidation below the lows (29800)

Reason?

great RR

if the leverage longs I mentioned on yesterday stream are going to stop us going up, then it should deviate 31500 and reverse. If that happens, can cut the 31k trade at breakeven.
‎
If breakout is valid, good entry.

The French riots are a symptom of high inflation and rising interest rates
‎
Political unrest and populism rise when the lower end of the economic pyramid start to suffer
‎
Easy mode is over, expect to see more of this across the world as people become increasingly unhappy with their life

This is how extreme right or left wing governments get in

the days of boring Clinton Bush or Obama are gone

Study populism throughout history and look at its effect on markets

next 5-10 years are likely to be dominated by populist policies

in the west, it means fiscal stimulus
‎
AKA Give people money to shut them up and buy their votes

Trump, de santis, RFK
‎
All populist
‎
Sweden elected a right wing govt
Italy elected a right wing govt
‎
It doesn’t just have to be right wing (RFK is a Democrat)

but after the Covid shit which was pushed by left wing governments, the people are flipping the other way
‎
Right wing populism = freedom, which is sexy after covid oppression

we could see big changes in the EU this decade

this all matters to crypto because it’s philosophically aligned with freedom

any smart politician will run on a pro crypto (or at least pro bitcoin) agenda

Brexit was populist

It was pushed as a battle for Nationalism over globalism

GM
Should see an impulse to 30500 from here
will look deeper in daily levels

“The USD/ EUR/ GBP is losing value”
when you say this, the average normie doesn’t understand
Remember how they think
They go on holiday once a year from UK to Ibiza
and however many € they can get for their £ is what matters
Right now, they get the same number of € as they did last year

“the pound is strong!”
This is the central bank game
they all see what eachother is doing, and keep a nice balance so the plebs don’t wake up.
Imagine this:
January > June: Britain prints a shitload of £. Europe doesn’t. £ gets weaker (down 10%)
July > December: Europe prints a shitload of €. UK doesn’t. € gets weaker (down 10%)
The net result is £1 is still getting you the same amount of €, but both central banks have inflated their supply.
they average person is getting poorer in real time and they don’t even know it.
That’s debasement of currency. You need to understand this. Ignorance is unacceptable. Don’t bury your head in the sand!
Eventually this makes hard assets (specifically BTC) inevitable. The guy buying € for his Ibiza holiday doesn’t even know he’s fucked yet. Millions/ billions of people still don’t know. By the time they know, the only thing possibly they can buy is BTC. Think they’re gonna be able to buy gold/ real estate? Not a chance.

GM
btc just hanging around near the lows now
Not even really choppy, just seems to have a lack of interest at these levels
<#1087256170512777296> uploading as we speak

the first leg down is to stop out/ liquidate leverage longs
the second, third, fourth dips are designed to test the patience and conviction of spot buyers
Blackrock news got everyone bullish, and rightly so
but many will have loaded up on spot above 30k
some who didnt buy anything during the bear, or at 16, 20, 25k will have made their FIRST buy above 30k
these are the ones who are going to be tested
If we reclaim 29700 in quick fashion, it's likely that we were just hunting leverage stops
But I think there are a few weeks of shakeout to come here to the downside
daily levels uploading now

This point was actually recognized by a student 2 days ago and asked if he should be keeping his capital in the SOPS while RSPS is in cash. It was a very insightful idea
Not entirely sure it would materialize in significant additional profits over time, as accumulating enough 'minimum holding time' to see expected returns in line with the backtests might take several years
Still, very smart idea
I think the best way to take advantage of the SOPS is to simply run it in parallel with the other strategies

LTC is now the most at risk coin, because bulls failed to pump the market
I’m sure a vast majority of longs from yesterdays dip were on LTC given the halving narrative
They will have to puke because they’re paper hands
if you have true conviction on LTC you don’t wait until 1 day before halving to get long
and once halving occurs some of the long term holders will naturally want to sell too
so if BTC trades back down below 29k, LTC probably goes to $80
Im still waiting for a BTC rally, which I think is coming
But the eventual direction remains the same imo
sideways/ choppy, then a quick upwards move to clear out shorts and then down

Might not even get a bounce here, everything is weak
I’ve taken profit on most of my btc long now, still a small amount open but I’m short alts since the other day (link and SNX)
Imo the next best buying opportunity comes when BTC takes out yesterdays low

looks like squeeze is over for now

reached above 29400 and met resistance

back to chop now I think

i've closed all my short trades in profit, and the BTC long at breakeven


only trade i have left open is LTC short

send it to zero lol

solid
shows a strong market
and now traders are pricing in further rate hikes
Markets pushed up on NY open but short term pullback likely now

seems to be an inverse correlation between YGG and other shitcoins
probbaly due to it sucking up so much of the liquidity
Seems like shorts piling in to BTC at the lows

Could take the local lows then push higher towards 29700

If not today or this week, I expect more sideways action for the coming weeks until something pushes us higher
NVDA selling off seems to be part of the reason for weakness in stocks

BTC selling off as if MSTR has been buying

(Microstrategy)
Btw, the BTC and AKT pattern is playing out the same so far
AKT ran first ahead of the market in may
After AKT top, rest of market continued to chop and go down

If same happens, AKT would consolidate again while market chops lower before ultimately forming a bottom

Probably across the rest of this month if it plays out

its just something that caught my eye last time, doesn’t have to mean anything but I’ll keep an eye on it

You never know who is moving AKT and what their plans are
2024 isnt far away, but it is if you try to over trade it
right now i think we are getting close to a temporary bottom, but I'm hoping to see one more push down
OI is ramping up hard, with CVDs all negative
the red line (futures) above green line (spot) on CVD showed spot selling was leading, until that last push where futures started to liquidate longs / add shorts
Liquidations (red square) are pretty steady
New York session open is in 2 hours

most reliable way to find a bottom, is of course to first wait for price action
‎
then, look for divergence on volume, liquidations, spot volume, derivs delta
